Preferred Knowledge Equivalent to: Special relativity: I expect that the students are familiar with basic notions of four-vectors and Lorentz transformations. The Relativistic Electrodynamics chapter (Chapter 12 in the third edition) in Griffith’s EM book is an excellent reference to revise these. Initial chapters from Griffiths, particularly on Electrostatic and Magnetostatic, needs to be revised.

Preferred Knowledge Equivalent to: Knowledge of M.Sc level Classical Mecghanics (Ph508), Quantum Mechanics I & II (PH503 and PH504).  Also some  understanding of special relativity is required for an effective learning of the course.
